item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

So:

public class LanguageComponent extends Verb, Adjective, Noun {
}

would be valid or this is multiple inheritance and would be invalid.

I understand exactly what you just said, so I will begin to re-write. I also want GUI (which I have the resources) so I can scrap the batch file.

Thanks for your help and suggestion, Miss.

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Well if I was going to build this I would have

Class LanguageComponent be extended by Verb Adjective Noun and so on

you may even want to create a interface called LanguageRuleset that would contain the methods for deciding what LanguageComponent should be called next in the story.

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Okay:

Here’s my first ever Java project I’m experimenting with. It’s a useless tool, but the main point in it is for me to use different aspects so as to learn the main principles, understandings and logic of Java: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,465541.0.html

What I wanted to do next is to call each string from the batch file so that it displays all the elements in the first string for when I press 1and display all the elements in the second string for when I press 2 etc. all the way to string six.

Here’s the current working class:

/*
 * Men.class
 * 
 * Version 1.2
 *
 * 20th November 2010
 * 
 * Author: Mendorphins
 */

   import java.util.Random;
 
	public class Men { 

		public static void main (String[] args) {

		/*
		 *First string 1
		 */
	String[] fs1 = { "Mendorphins ", "Michael Jackson ", "Andrew Gower ", "Bill Gates ", "Stevie Wonder ", "50 Cent ", 			 	 "Simon Cowell ", "Tinky Winky ", "Jeremy Clarkson ", "Richard Hammond ", "James May ", 
			 "Tony Blair ", "George Bush ", "Sadam Hussein ", "Eric Cartman ", "Bin Laden ", 
			 "My mother in law ", "Your crackhead grandma ", "The Asian community ", "This fat chick ", 
			 "Jesus ", "Mary ", "Joseph ", "Bob ", "Fred ", "Frank ", "Dennis ", "Harry ", "Dave ", "Tom ", 			 	 "That smelly Indian ", "An African child ", "This African bum cleaner ", "Marshall ", "Borat ",
			 "My Uncle's monkey ", "A China man ", "Azamat Bagatov ", "My brother Bilo ", 
			 "This is my sister. She is number four prostitute of whole of Khazakstan and she " };
		/*
		 *Second string 2
		 */	
	String[] ss2 = { "has to ", "wants to ", "should not ", "got bribed by a black man to ", "thought they would ", 			 	 "had an accident and therefore had to ", "more than likely wants to ", "probably should ", 
			 "can't exactly ", "hopes to God that their mum wants to " };

		/*
	 	 *Third string 3
	 	 */	
	String[] ts3 = { "rape ", "have sex with ", "set on fire ", "pinch ", "murder ", "poo on ", "smile at ", 
			 "play with ", "finger ", "toss off ", "wank off ", "discombobulate ", "make babies with ", 
			 "make a baby with ", "smell ", "fart on ", "grate the end off of ", "tea bag ", "eat ", "wedgey ", 			 "bog flush ", "disembark on an adventure with ", "fuck ", "masturbate ", 
			 "sing a sweet lullaby to ", "do something quite inappropriate to ", "give a blow job to ", 
			 "be a carpet muncher with " };

		/*
	 	 *Fourth string 4
	 	 */
	String[] fs4 = { "your ", "their ", "my " };

		/*
		 *Fifth string 5
	 	 */
	String[] fs5 = { "smelly ", "sexy ", "stupid ", "butt ugly ", "lovely ", "pretty ", "stinky ", "shit stained ", 			 	 "crab invested ", "spunk flavoured ", "fat ", "skinny ", "trampy ", "drunken ", "cheesey ", 			 		 "mother's ", "father's ", "nan's ", "hairdresser's ", "manager's ", "wife's ", "husband's ", 			 		 "children's ", "sister's " };

		/*
	 	 *Sixth String 6
	 	 */	
	String[] ss6 = { "vagina.", "penis.", "pet dog.", "hamster.", "doctor.", "mother.", "father.", "arsehole.", 
			 "belly button.", "scrotum.", "stink hole.", "piss flaps.", "ball bag.", "Indian friend.". 
			 "stinky winky.", "crotch.", "flange.", "cunt.", "clitorous.", "cock.", "large shlong.", 
			 "purple headed mushroom.", "Jap's eye." };

		/*
		 *Random generator, segments 1 - 6
		 */
	int ra1 = new Random().nextInt(fs1.length);
	int ra2 = new Random().nextInt(ss2.length);
	int ra3 = new Random().nextInt(ts3.length);
	int ra4 = new Random().nextInt(fs4.length);
	int ra5 = new Random().nextInt(fs5.length);
	int ra6 = new Random().nextInt(ss6.length);

		/*
	 	 *Final output
	 	 */
	System.out.println("\n\t" + fs1[ra1] + ss2[ra2] + ts3[ra3] + fs4[ra4] + fs5[ra5] + ss6[ra6] 			   			   + "\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n");


 	}
       }

and here’s the broken one that I tried to do last night but failed:

/*
 * Men.class
 * 
 * Version 1.2
 *
 * 20th November 2010
 * 
 * Author: Mendorphins
 */

   import java.util.Random;

	class Output {

			/*
			 *Random generator, segments 1 - 6
			 */
				int ra1 = new Random().nextInt(ReadFirst.fs1.length);
				int ra2 = new Random().nextInt(ReadSecond.ss2.length);
				int ra3 = new Random().nextInt(ReadThird.ts3.length);
				int ra4 = new Random().nextInt(ReadFourth.fs4.length);
				int ra5 = new Random().nextInt(ReadFifth.fs5.length);
				int ra6 = new Random().nextInt(ReadSixth.ss6.length);

			/*
	 		 *Final output
	 		 */
				System.out.println("\n\t" + ReadFirst.fs1[ra1] + ReadSecond.ss2[ra2] + ReadThird.ts3[ra3] 						   + ReadFourth.fs4[ra4] + ReadFifth.fs5[ra5] + ReadSixth.ss6[ra6] 
						   + "\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n");
		}

	class ReadFirst {

			/*
	 		 *First string 1
			 */
			static String[] fs1 = { "Mendorphins ", "Michael Jackson ", "Andrew Gower ", "Bill Gates ", 
						"Stevie Wonder ", "50 Cent ", "Simon Cowell ", "Tinky-Winky ", 
						"Jeremy Clarkson ", "Richard Hammond ", "James May ", "Tony Blair ", 						"George Bush ", "Sadam Hussein ", "Eric Cartman ", "Bin-Laden ", 
						"My mother-in-law ", "Your crackhead grandma ", "The Asian community ", 						"This fat chick ", "Jesus ", "Mary ", "Joseph ", "Bob ", "Fred ", "Frank ", 						"Dennis ", "Harry ", "Dave ", "Tom ", "That smelly Indian ", 
						"An African child ", "This African bum cleaner ", "Marshall ", "Borat " };

						}

	class ReadSecond {

			/*
	 	 	 *Second string 2
	 	 	 */	
			static String[] ss2 = { "has to ", "wants to ", "should not ", "got bribed by a black man to ", 						"thought they would ", "had an accident and therefore had to ", 
						"more than likely wants to ", "probably should ", "can't exactly ", 
						"hopes to God that their mum wants to " };

		}

	class ReadThird {

			/*
	 		 *Third string 3
	 		 */
			static String[] ts3 = { "rape ", "have sex with ", "set on fire ", "pinch ", "murder ", "poo on ", 						"smile at ", "play with ", "finger ", "toss off ", "wank off ", 						"discombobulate ", "make babies with ", "make a baby with ", "smell ", 						"fart on ", "grate the end off of ", "tea-bag ", "eat ", "wedgey ", 
						"bog flush ", "disembark on an adventure with ", "fuck ", "masturbate ", 						"sing a sweet lullaby to ", "do something quite inappropriate to " };

		}

	class ReadFourth {

			/*
	 		 *Fourth string 4
	 		 */
			static String[] fs4 = { "your ", "their ", "my " };

		}
		
	class ReadFifth {

			/*
	 		 *Fifth string 5
	 		 */
			static String[] fs5 = { "smelly ", "sexy ", "stupid ", "butt-ugly ", "lovely ", "pretty ", 
						"stinky ", "shit-stained ", "crab-invested ", "spunk-flavoured ", 
						"fat ", "skinny ", "trampy ", "drunken ", "cheesey ", "mother's ", 						"father's ", "nan's ", "hair-dresser's ", "manager's ", "wife's ", 						"husband's ", "children's ", "sister's " };

		}
		
	class ReadSixth {

			/*
	 		 *Sixth String 6
	 		 */
			static String[] ss6 = { "vagina.", "penis.", "pet dog.", "hamster.", "doctor.", "mother.", 						"father.", "arsehole.", "belly button.", "scrotum.", "stink-hole." };

		}
 
	public class Men { 

		public static void main (String[] args) {

			for (int i = 0; i < ReadFirst.fs1.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the first string...\n");
				System.out.println("Element found: " + ReadFirst.fs1[i]);
			}

			for (int i = 0; i < ReadSecond.ss2.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the second string...\n");
				System.out.println("\tElement found: " + ReadSecond.ss2[i]);
			}
			
			for (int i = 0; i < ReadThird.ts3.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the third string...\n");
				System.out.println("\tElement found: " + ReadThird.ts3[i]);
			}

			for (int i = 0; i < ReadFourth.fs4.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the fourth string...\n");
				System.out.println("\tElement found: " + ReadFourth.fs4[i]);
			}

			for (int i = 0; i < ReadFifth.fs5.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the fifth string...\n");
				System.out.println("\tElement found: " + ReadFifth.fs5[i]);
			}

			
			for (int i = 0; i < ReadSixth.ss6.length; i++) {
				System.out.println("\t\nReading Elements for the sixth string...\n");
				System.out.println("\tElement found: " + ReadSixth.ss6[i]);
	 }
 	}
       }

I did create public voids in each class (not the public class) but they gave more errors, and I did have ReadFirst, ReadSecond etc. in seperate Java files, but that did not work either.

So I wanted the output to print all of the elements of:

String[] fs1 = { "element1 ", "element2 ", "etc. " };

into the batch when I called it.

Example for Initialize.bat

Element found: element1
Element found: element2
Element found: etc.
press any key to continue...

But instead it prints all six strings and how many elements are in those strings, not the actual words.

Hope this is a little bit more thorough.

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Well, I have just realised there is no real point in making seperate classes for just one method. In my main method, I have six strings and I want to display a list of the elements for each string seperately.

It kept running through all six strings and I thought it’d be easier to seperate the six strings into classes and then extend the class to the new six classes so they could communicate with one another seperately.

I think I need to create voids and call each void instead?

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

java does not support multiple inheritance

but there generally is no need for it, why dont you explain your specific case and what you’re trying to achieve

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You cannot extend more then 1 class without having to re work the limitations.

http://www.coderanch.com/t/380144/java/java/Why-cannot-java-class-extend

Read full topic

item.title: Class extends Class
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Is it possible for me to extend more than one class in any one class?

/*
 *Example
 */

public class Mendorphins extends Example extends AnotherExample {
}

If not, is there a proper way of doing this?

Read full topic
